channel.title: Posts on English study
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on English study

item.title: Giving away free money
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: Giving away free money すごい人見つけちゃいました。 望みを言うだけで簡単にお金がもらえる？ That’s all you have to do. I am currently selecting folks to send my hard-earned money to, with no strings attached. Request $1, $10, $100 or $1000. No amount is too big or too small, and I will read every e-mail and consider every need and want. I know this is a bizarre concept. But no, I don’t want to send you information.

item.title: Big Image Sample
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: The image banners at the top of the page are refered to as “bigimg” in this theme. They are optional, and one more more can be specified. If more than one is specified, the images rotate every 10 seconds. In the front matter, bigimgs are specified using an array of hashes.

item.title: Math Sample
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
KaTeX can be used to generate complex math formulas server-side.

$$ \phi = \frac{(1+\sqrt{5})}{2} = 1.6180339887\cdots $$

Additional details can be found on GitHub or on the Wiki.

item.title: Flake it till you make it
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: Under what circumstances should we step off a path? When is it essential that we finish what we start? If I bought a bag of peanuts and had an allergic reaction, no one would fault me if I threw it out. If I ended a relationship with a woman who hit me, no one would say that I had a commitment problem. But if I walk away from a seemingly secure route because my soul has other ideas, I am a flake?

Nigel. Issue going well? Oh, yes. Our best September ever. Great. Heard Miranda killed autumn jackets and pulled up the Sedona shoot. What’s that costing me? About ,. Must have been some lousy jackets.

Be ready to leave in half an hour. 693 00:42:06,360 –> 00:42:09,880 But we’re not expected until Tuesday. Did she say why? 694 00:42:09,960 –> 00:42:12,640 Yes.

item.title: Devil wears prada(6)

item.description: 続きはこちら devil wear prada（7/7） 重要表現 Chapter 6 839 00:50:51,960 –> 00:50:53,800 - Excuse me. - [Horn Honks] 840 00:51:04,200 –> 00:51:06,880 - Welcome to the St. Regis. May I assist you with anything? - Oh. Yes. 841 00:51:07,000 –> 00:51:09,880 - Uh, I’m meeting someone at the King Cole Bar. - Right this way. 842 00:51:12,400 –> 00:51:14,200 Hi. 843 00:51:14,320 –> 00:51:16,880 - You have one hour.

[Scoffs] - Thank God I saved your job. 1014 01:01:42,000 –> 01:01:46,640 [Stammers, Chuckles] You know, I figured out a few things on my own too. 1015 01:01:46,720 –> 01:01:49,000 Turns out, I’m not as nice as you thought.

item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: 続きはこちら devil wear prada（3/11） devil wear prada（4/11） devil wear prada（5/11） 重要表現 run errands 雑用する deal weth it やって！ Do you have some prior commitment? 先約があるの？ celluite セルライト Chapter2 (00:11:24~) Hello? Andrea, Miranda decided to kill the autumn jacket story for September… and she is pulling up the Sedona shoot from October. You need to come into the office right this second and pick up her coffee order on the way.

item.title: Devil wears prada
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: 続きはこちら devil wear prada（2/11） devil wear prada（3/11） devil wear prada（4/11） 重要表現 「not to mention a legend」 言うまでもなく伝説である 「million girls would kill for this job」 みんなが憧れる仕事だ 「paunchy」 太鼓腹の 「Don’t be a jerk」 ひどい人〜笑 Chapter 1 Hi. Uh, I have an appointment with Emily Charlton? Andrea Sachs? Yes. Great. Human Resources certainly has an odd sense of humor. Follow me. Okay, so I was Miranda’s second assistant…

item.title: Love, Rosie
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: Love, Rosie Take a deep breath and start at the beginning. Tell them how we first met. Hi. Hi. Alex Stewart? Tell them that ever since we shared our dreams… Yeah! Yeah! I had a dream last night. …even Alex’s weirdest ones. You know a rowing boat? That little curvy bit the oar sits in? It’s called a rollock, by the way. A what? Rollock, like “bollock” with an “R.
